com.att.research.xacml.util

Class ObjUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.research.xacml.util.ObjUtil

  • public class ObjUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    ObjUtil provides utilities for comparing objects in various circumstances.
    Version:
    $Revision$
    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • equalsAllowNull

        public static <T> boolean equalsAllowNull(T obj1,
                          T obj2)
        Determines if two objects of the same class are equivalent, including the case where both are null.
        Parameters:
        obj1 - the first object to compare
        obj2 - the second object to compare
        Returns:
        true if both objects are null, or the first is non-null and equals the second.

      • xmlEqualsAllowNull

        public static boolean xmlEqualsAllowNull(org.w3c.dom.Node node1,
                         org.w3c.dom.Node node2)
        Determines if two XML Nodes are equivalent, including the case where both are null. For XML Nodes the .equals() method does not work (the objects must actually be the same Node). In this project we want to allow XML with different textual layout (newlines and spaces) to be equal because the text formatting is not significant to the meaning of the content. Therefore the (Node).isEqualNode() method is not appropriate either. This method looks at the Node elements and each of their children: - ignoring empty text nodes - ignoring comment nodes - checking that all attributes on the nodes are the same - checking that each non-empty-text child is in the same order
        Parameters:
        node1 - the first Node object to compare
        node2 - the second Node object to compare
        Returns:
        true if both objects are null, or the first is non-null and equals the second as described in the method description.
